intro: Myrsine turquinensis, commonly known as the Turquin's myrsine, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Réunion in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and produces small, white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky areas. Myrsine turquinensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
